snippet: The European Central Bank left interest rates unchanged, but its president stopped short of announcing new stimulus measures for the eurozone economy.
abstract: Stock market posts slight losses after European Central Bank officials decided to delay any stimulus until 2015.
lead_paragraph: The European Central Bank left interest rates unchanged, but its president stopped short of announcing new stimulus measures for the eurozone economy.

headline.main: Europe’s Stimulus Delay Weighs on U.S. Markets
headline.print_headline: Europe’s Stimulus Delay Weighs on U.S. Markets
